newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Spain says supports Slovenia's EU, NATO bids.
newsitem.headline: Spain says supports Slovenia's EU, NATO bids.

text.p: Spain supports Slovenia's bids for membership of NATO and the European Union, Spain's state secretary at the Foreign Ministry said on Wednesday.

"Spain will back Slovenia's entry to NATO and the EU based on objective criteria," Romon de Miguel told a news conference during a two-day visit to Ljubljana. "We firmly believe Slovenia meets the criteria for both."
Spain also supports Slovenia's bid to enter the United Nations Security Council as a non-permanent member in the years 1998 and 1999.
Slovenia signed the association agreement with the EU in June 1996 and said it would ratify it by the end of June.

Nine other former communist states -- Poland, Hungary, the Czech Republic, Slovakia, Estonia, Lithuania, Latvia, Romania and Bulgaria -- have already signed EU association agreements and are seeking full membership. REUTER
